result.execSummary:
The defendant Philip P Capone III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Corut orders the $200.00 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant credit for 39 days served.

records.addlTxt:
2:06 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney John Selsing.

Attorney Selsing recites the agreement - plea to OWI - 2nd (count 1 - 2014CT3) , DC (count 2 - 2014CF111), Bail Jumping - felony (count 1 - 2014CF120).  Balance of counts to be DRI.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  

2014CF120
Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.  DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Selsing.  Attorney Selsing confirms receipt of the Information - enters a plea of NO CONTEST - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties on this count.  Court DRI counts 2 and 3 on 2014CF120.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties on each count.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds each plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support each plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the indicated counts and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court dismisses count 2 on 2014CT3, DRI count 3 on 2014CT3.  Court DRI balance of the counts on 2014CF120, 2014CF114, and 2014CF111.  

Statement by Cheyenne G.  Sentencing argument by DA - requests 39 days of jail credit.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Selsing.  Statement by the defendant.

2014CT3 (count 1 - OWI-2nd) .13%
Sentenced to 10 days county jail - commence immediately - with huber.
$400 fine plus court costs - 60 days to pay or payment plan.
13 month drivers license revocation
13 monthof IID.
Undergo AODA.

2014CF111 (count 2 - Disorderly Conduct)
Sentenced to 39 days county jail - with credit for 39 days served.  
Pay court costs - 60 days to pay or payment plan.

2014CF120 (count 1 - Bail Jumping-Felony)
Court orders SWD and placed on probation for 2 years
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink which will include his own restaurant.
Complete an AODA assessment.
Abide with all rules/recommendations imposed by the supervising agent.
Pay court costs.

Court orders all cash bond on file to be applied on all fines.

Court adjourned at 2:
Status hearing on November 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
By Atty John Selsing
Status hearing on November 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

2:14 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Barb Privat.

2014CT3
Defendant is currently represented by Attorney Smerlinski.  Attorney Smerlinski has submitted a motion to withdraw on that case.  

Attorney Privat makes statement - defendant is eligible for representation - PD will be appointing counsel on the three felony cases.  Would appoint on the CT case if the court grants the motion to withdraw.  Court grants the motion of Attorney Smerlinski to withdraw on 2014CT3.  

Attorney Privat requests an adjournment of the preliminary hearings - waives time limits.  Defendant concurs.  Court notes the waiver of the time limits.

Court directs all cases be set for Status Hearing, regarding counsel.

Court adjourned at 2:18 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

1:07 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - initial appearance has not been held on 2014CF114 & 2014CF120.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaints and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count/case.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his right to an attorney.  Bond has already been set on each case.  Statement by defendant in regards to bond.  Statement by the Court - denies the request to modidy bond.  Court instructs defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing in approx ten days.

Court adjourned at 1:18 p.m.
Status hearing on October 14, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant is to have NO contact with CRG (8/11/97)    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Bail Bond deposit Acknowledgement w/copy of Bail/Bond
w/conditions

Defendant is to have NO contact with CRG (8/11/97)    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:04 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail, without an attorney.

Defendant confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  

Court orders bond set at $200 cash bond with the conditions of:   No contact with CRG (8/11/97).    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  

Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing and it's time limits.  Defendant waives the time limits.  

Court directs this case be set for Status Hearing, regarding counsel, to be held in approximately two weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:10 p.m.
